      Constructs a FamilyTree with the given progenitor as the head of the family tree.

  • Method Details

    • getHead

      public Node<Person> getHead()
      Returns:
      the head

    • findPerson

      public Person findPerson(String name, LocalDate birthday)
      Finds a person in the family tree with the specified name and birthday using breadth-first search.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the person to search for
      birthday - the birthday of the person to search for
      Returns:
      the Person object if found, or null if not found

    • findPerson

      public Person findPerson(Person target)
      Finds a person in the family tree matching the provided target person using breadth-first search.
      Parameters:
      target - the person object to search for
      Returns:
      the Person object if found, or null if not found

    • findPeople

      public List<Person> findPeople(String name)
      Finds people in the family tree with the specified name using breadth-first search.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the people to search for
      Returns:
      a List containing Person objects with matching names, or an empty list if none are found

    • addChild

      public boolean addChild(Person parent, Person currentSpouse, Person child)
      Adds a child to the specified parent and their current spouse. This method first attempts to find the specified parent and their current spouse in the family tree. If both parent and spouse are found, and they are each other's current spouses, the child is added to both parents. Otherwise, the child is not added and the method returns false.
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent to whom the child will be added.
      currentSpouse - The current spouse of the parent.
      child - The child to be added to the parent and their spouse.
      Returns:
      true if the child is successfully added to both parents, false otherwise.

    • addChild

      public boolean addChild(Person parent, Person child)
      Adds a child to a specified parent and creates another parent of the opposite gender, adding the child to both parents.
      Parameters:
      parent - The parent to whom the child will be added.
      child - The child to be added to the parent.
      Returns:
      true if the child is successfully added to both parents, false otherwise.

    • assignParent

      public boolean assignParent(Person parent, Person child)
      Assigns a parent to a child if the child does not already have a parent assigned.
      Parameters:
      parent - the parent to assign
      child - the child to assign the parent to
      Returns:
      true if the parent was successfully assigned to the child, false otherwise

    • marry

      public boolean marry(Person spouseA, Person spouseB)
      Marries two persons by updating their marital status and partner lists. If both spouses are found and are already married to each other, their existing marriage is dissolved. If only one spouse is found, they are married to a new person of the opposite gender. If neither spouse is found, the method returns false.
      Parameters:
      spouseA - The first person to be married.
      spouseB - The second person to be married.
      Returns:
      true if the marriage is successful, false otherwise.

    • areBloodRelated

      public boolean areBloodRelated(Person a, Person b)
      Checks if two persons are blood-related within the family tree.
      Parameters:
      a - the first person to check for blood relation
      b - the second person to check for blood relation
      Returns:
      true if both persons are blood-related within the family tree, otherwise false

    • getSiblings

      public Set<Person> getSiblings(Person target)
      Retrieves the set of siblings for a given person. Siblings share at least one parent with the specified person. Returns an empty set if the person has no siblings.
      Parameters:
      target - The person for whom siblings are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A set containing the siblings of the target person, or an empty set if there are none.

    • divorce

      public boolean divorce(Person target)
      Divorces the specified person from their spouse. This method sets the marital status of both the divorcer and their spouse to false, effectively ending their marriage.
      Parameters:
      target - the person who wants to get divorced
      Returns:
      true if the divorce was successfully processed, false otherwise

    • adopt

      public boolean adopt(Person newParent, Person child)
      Allows a person to adopt another person as their child.
      Parameters:
      newParent - the person adopting the child
      child - the person being adopted
      Returns:
      true if the adoption is successful (i.e., the child is not already related to the adoptive parent), false otherwise
